questions.title: Cracker
questions.definition: A harmful individual who destroys everything in their path using viruses and tools that they develop, often breaking security in systems and programs

questions.title: Modder
questions.definition: A person who modifies or customizes software, games, or hardware to enhance functionality, improve performance, or create new features

questions.title: Malware
questions.definition: Malicious software designed to harm or exploit any programmable device or network

questions.title: Password Cracker
questions.definition: An application used to identify unknown or forgotten passwords for computers or network resources. It can also assist a human cracker in gaining unauthorized access

questions.title: Exploit
questions.definition: A specific method of using a vulnerability to gain entry into a system

questions.title: Brute Force
questions.definition: A method for discovering a password by trying all possible combinations until the correct one is found

questions.title: Worm
questions.definition: A self-replicating program that spreads across systems by copying itself, consuming resources from the targeted systems

questions.title: Pirate
questions.definition: A person who copies and distributes illegal software, including cracked commercial software and registered shareware, and who is different from a "hacker"

questions.title: Tracing
questions.definition: The process of tracking information about a person through the network

questions.title: Virus
questions.definition: A program that self-replicates and often attacks other programs, creating copies of itself and potentially damaging data

questions.title: Adware
questions.definition: Software used by hackers to forcibly display advertisements on a system

questions.title: Backdoor
questions.definition: Also known as a trapdoor, it is a means of bypassing normal authentication to access a computer system

questions.title: Bot
questions.definition: A program designed to automate tasks, allowing actions to be performed more frequently

questions.title: White Hat Hacker
questions.definition: An ethical hacker who aims to identify weaknesses in systems or networks without causing harm

questions.title: Black Hat Hacker
questions.definition: A cracker who seeks unauthorized access to networks or systems with the intent to cause damage
